page.title: 06INTERVIEW - BROWN FARM
page.content: Weather The annual rainfall is about 40 inches, Dulverton - 10 miles west recieves 60 inches while the Vale of Taunton only gets 20 inches. The further east one goes the less the rainfall because of the steepness of the hills, the grass stays green all the summer except in times of drought. The council is of no help if it snows and the farmers have to dig themselves out with a special attachment fixed to one of the local tractors. The problem is that the council has a very large area to cover including many narrow roads with isolated communities.
